ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: During this course, I learned a lot of grammar and cultural connections. I also feel I gained a much stronger ability to speak and converse in casual conversation with my peers.
Built on content learnt during L1 and L2 Spanish and became much more confident at speaking and gained conversational skills.
Intermediate Spanish! A lot of grammar and practice talking.
In this class I improved my Spanish speaking, writing, comprehension, and grammar skills. I also learned about literature, movies, and cultural aspects of Spanish speaking countries.
I gained further insights into Spanish culture as well as the ability to learn more vocabulary and work on skills that I struggled with in previous semesters.
I reinforced my knowledge on grammar and expanded my vocabulary in Spanish. I also learned about the Hispanic community in Nee Haven.
I learned a lot about conjugations and vocabulary for different scenarios.

This course was a great way to be introduced to more complicated Spanish literature, poems and films. I really improved my ability to write detailed and informed comprehension, my everyday vocabulary and more appreciation for Latin American history.
Spanish grammar, vocabulary, Latin American culture and contemporary issues

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: There were a lot of different types of media content that we could learn from, whether that be books, movies, poems, or art. I think this allowed students to engage with Spanish in their own unique ways. I think the course could be improved by having more one-on-one engagement with other students.
More clear expectations of what assignments are practice vs what should be handed in.
One weakness of this course was I felt it could be disorganized at times. I think it could be improved by making due dates clearer and always ensuring the due date on Canvas is correct.
The supersite homework could have been spread out more. We finished all the homework activities for the semester a little after halfway through.

Strengths: let's you learn another language
Weaknesses: is graded, syllabus was a little unclear at times

Strengths: The texts we analysed all had a social message and important relevance to Latin American history. The experiential learning assignments and reflections also all really helped with writing and immersion practice. 

Weaknesses: I felt that some of the activities were very repetitive - we did about 3 role plays after Spring Break which I feel could have had more variety instead. I'm not sure of the value of these in practising oral skills given student  practice a lot at home.

My Spanish greatly improved throughout the course of the semester thanks to the structure of this class - rather than focusing entirely on vocabulary and grammar, we learned the language through short stories, short films, movies, and other works of art from Spanish-speaking countries. We were given ample opportunities to engage during class time and practice our speaking. Expectations and assignments were unclear in the class, especially towards the end of the semester. Things deviated from the syllabus and communication was disorganized because it was a mix of hard copy assignments and assignments listed on Canvas. Many in the class were confused about what the assigned homework was each night.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would recommend this course. The content is interesting and you learn a lot of new grammar/vocab skills. The content of the class keeps it  engaging, and I was excited to be able to talk about complex topics and themes while practicing my Spanish. The course load is reasonable, and I never felt swamped with work; however, at times, the day-to-day tasks were unclear and I wasn't sure what the work was. By communicating with my peers and classmates, I was able to manage this perfectly fine, but I do think this was the only confusing  part of the class, as it sometimes felt unstructured.
Yes I would recommend this course because I learned a lot and improved a lot in an important language. The professor was engaging and helpful.
I would recommend this course to other students interested in learning Spanish.
I would definitely recommend this course. It's a good step up from L2 and prepares you well to start advanced Spanish training
Yes, highly recommend. Sebastian is great and I would recommend any course he teaches.
Yes, if you want to learn Spanish this is an excellent, thorough, well-instructed course
